Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Sodium Nitroprusside for Blood Pressure Control in Pediatric Surgery

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive a blinded infusion followed by open-label SNP

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the dose-response relationship of SNP in infants and children undergoing major surgery and to perform a quantitative assessment of BP control.

Method_Outcome.evidence: BP was recorded using an arterial catheter.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Result_Outcome.evidence: BP was controlled an average of 45.4% (SD 23.9%, 95% CI 41.5%-49.18%) of the time.
